content.rendered:
Some illustration-led projects this week with work from Adelaide, Stockholm, and Verona.

Fat Controller Club by Frame

Fat Controller is a night club and live music venue in Adelaide, Australia, with a hip, underground Strange Days vibe. The titular character, as designed by local design firm Frame, is clearly a controller who is fat. Cartoonishly fat, with a top hat that not only looks boss on him but also makes him look like the boss of the place, which is a lair of metal fences and red neon lights. The thin-line drawings of the logo and additional illustrations are complemented with cool and energetic typography, all in the same color palette as the club itself. See full project

Gretas by 25AH

Gretas is a café located in the Haymarket hotel in Stockholm with a self-described “modern interpretation of the 1920s”, which has been visualized in the identity by local firm 25AH. The hotel’s building used to be a department store and has a beautiful facade — related trivia: this department store, PUB, is where actress Greta Garbo worked before being an actress — that 25AH interpreted as a crisp vector illustration that is then used in tight crops in the cafe’s applications, all executed in a sophisticated palette of pink and dark muted green. The script logo is okay, I wish it were less wispy or had a stronger presence. See full project

Crude by Happycentro

Crude is a new line of raw chocolate from Italian confectioner Sabadí. Designed by Verona, Italy-based Happycentro, the packaging mixes raw cardboard with different-colored foil stamping to create a beautiful contrast. I almost wrote, “I have no idea what the illustrations are meant to be” but luckily the coffee just kicked in and I realized that they are the cacao percentages of each bar (70, 80, 90, and 100), which makes for some stunning lettering. On the inside of the bars, yeah, I have no idea what those illustrations are meant to be but they look cool. The “UD” in the logo seems unnecessary as it doesn’t convey anything in particular about chocolate but, like the rest of the packaging, it looks cool. If close-ups of cardboard are as thrilling for you as eating chocolate is for me, then check the project link as there are a lot more photos. See full project
